meaningMnemonic:
You have the kanji for <kanji>empty</kanji>, so this verb means <vocabulary>to become empty</vocabulary>. 

It can also have a slightly different meaning when it's read differently, but you'll learn this through other words later on, so don't worry about it for now.
readingMnemonic: Whenever something is about <vocabulary>to become empty</vocabulary>, you can't help saying "<reading>Ah…</reading>" (あ) to express your disappointment. Your glass of water is becoming empty? Ah… Your bag of chips is becoming empty? Ah… Exclaiming a little "Ah…" is the only thing that helps you cope with the sadness of your favorite things becoming empty.
